question_text: When does the moment of inertia of a body come into the picture?
option_3_text: When the motion is along a curved path
answer_explanation_text:
The answer is A, The moment of inertia of a body come into picture when the motion is rotational.
Moment of inertia, denoted by I, measures the extent to which an object resists rotational acceleration about a particular axis, it is the rotational analogue to mass (which determines an object's resistance to linear acceleration). The moments of inertia of a mass have units of dimension ML2 ([mass] × [length]2).

question_text: The motion of planets in the solar system is an example of conservation of
answer_explanation_text:
Linear momentum is the vector quantity and defined as the product of the mass of an object, m, and its velocity, v.
In the motion of planets around the sun the angular momentum is conserved. That is the total angular momentum of the system is constant. This is because there is no external torque acting on the system. Angular momentum is the rotational analogue of linear momentum.
Therefore, C is the correct answer.

question_text: What does L<sup>2</sup>/2I represent?
option_3_text: The potential energy of a particle
option_4_text: The rotational kinetic energy of a particle
answer_explanation_text: The rotational kinetic energy is the kinetic energy of rotation of a rotating rigid body or system of particles, where I is the moment of inertia, or <q>rotational mass</q> of the rigid body or system of particles.

question_text: Consider two objects a disk and a sphere that has the same radius but different masses which roll down the two inclined planes with the same altitude and length. Out of the two objects, which one gets to the bottom of the plane first?
option_1_text: It is dependent on the masses of the objects
option_4_text: Both reach at the same time

question_text: When the torque acting on the system is zero, which of the following is constant?
answer_explanation_text: When the torque acting upon a system is zero, the angular momentum is constant and hence is conserved. This is analogous to the linear counterpart i.e. when the force on the system is zero, the momentum is conserved.

question_text: What is the frictional force of a round object with mass M and radius R which rolls down the inclined plane without slipping along the way?
option_1_text: There is a decrease in the rotational motion
option_2_text: There is a decrease in the rotational and translational motion
option_3_text: There is a conversion of translational motion into rotational motion
option_4_text: Kinetic energy is converted into heat
answer_explanation_text:
Given = round object
mass =M
radius = R
to find= frictional force
solution = when a body rolls down without slipping along a way, it rotates along horizontal axis, therefore rolling motion may regarded as arotational motion may be regarded as a rotational motion about an axisrequired frictional force converts translational energy into rotational energy.

we can find the frictional force by, F = μN.

question_text: On which of the following factor does the moment of inertia of an object NOT depend upon?
answer_explanation_text:
Option B- Angular Velocity.
Moment of Inertia depends on distribution of body (shape and size of the body), axis of rotation and mass of the body. It is not dependent on angular velocity of the body.

question_text: A particle moves down a line parallel to the positive X-axis at a constant speed. With respect to the origin, the magnitude of its angular momentum is,
A rope is looped around a hollow cylinder with a radius of 40 cm and a mass of 3 kg. If the rope is pulled with a force of 30 N, what is the angular acceleration of the cylinder?
Water is half filled into a closed cylindrical container. As the container rotates in a horizontal plane about a perpendicular bisector, what will be the effect on the moment of inertia?
answer_explanation_text:
Answer-A. The moment of inertia increases.
Since the distance of the mass from the axis of rotation of the cylinder increases on rotation about the perpendicular bisector, the moment of inertia will increase.

question_text: With an angular momentum of L, a rigid body rotates. What will be the angular momentum becomes, if the kinetic energy is halved?
A particle moves in a circular motion that is consistent. The particle's angular momentum will be conserved about
option_1_text: the centre point of the circle.
option_2_text: the point on the circumference of the circle.
answer_explanation_text: Where, L = angular momentum, α = angular acceleration, τnet = Net external torque. The torque of this force about the centre is zero. Hence, angular momentum about the centre remains conserved.

question_text: The angular momentum of a mass revolving in a plane around a fixed point is directed along
option_1_text: a line perpendicular to the rotation plane
option_2_text: the line that forms a 45° angle with the rotation plane
answer_explanation_text: When a mass is rotating in a plane about a fixed point, its angular momentum is directed along the axis of rotation.
